attributes.action: Honor the result of the 1975 UK EC membership referendum, and remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Full name of this referendum: The United Kingdom European Communities membership referendum
Date of referendum: 5 June 1975
Voter turnout: 64.62%
Yes votes: 17,378,581 (67.23%)
No votes: 8,470,073 (32.77%)

Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1975_United_Kingdom_European_Communities_membership_referendum
attributes.background:
In 1975, the UK government held a referendum asking the following:
"Do you think the United Kingdom should stay in the European Community (the Common Market)?"
In this referendum 17,378,581 people (67.23%) voted "Yes". In order to deliver on this result, the UK must not leave the EU.
